channel.title: Linux Links on JanTech
channel.description: Recent content in Linux Links on JanTech

item.title: List of educational and helpful links for Linux
item.description:
I will keep adding to this list

  • This will take some time to add everything to this list.

Linux Guru Links

  • Distro Tube: This guy is the one that is responsible for getting me started with Linux. Distro Tube GitLab: A great place to get some help to figure out your configs. Youtube, Odysee
  • Eric Murphy: I built my first website because Eric’s help. Here is his GitHub also he has a great YouTube channel with lots of help, you can find that here
  • Linux Dabbler is a great source for Linux Debian based help. He offers quite a bit of help with tilling window managers on Debian, his GitHub has lot of solutions for Debian. He really likes SpectrWM, you can watch him here on YouTube.
  • Luke Smith provides lots of info on many different topics, his YouTube can be found here and Odysee here

Audio on Linux

  • MOC and MOC GitHub page. This is my terminal based goto music player on Linux, super simple to use and very intuitive shortcut keys. sudo apt in stall moc
  • DeadBeef is my runner up for audio. sudo dpkg -i deadbeef-static_1.9.2-1_amd64.deb
  • Clementine sudo apt install clementine
  • Sayonara sudo apt install sayonara
  • Rhythmbox sudo apt install rhythmbox
  • Audacious sudo apt install audacious

Terminal Audio Player’s

  • MOC sudo apt install moc
  • Cmus sudo apt install cmus

Audio + Video Player’s

  • MPV sudo apt install mpv
  • VLC sudo apt install vlc
